meanings.definition: A person who wants to be like someone else or to achieve something, often lacking the necessary talent or experience.
meanings.sent1: The group of wannabes tried to copy the famous singer's style.
meanings.sent2: She always hangs out with the wannabes who imitate the popular kids.
meanings.sent3: The wannabes at the talent show made everyone laugh with their clumsy attempts.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of wannabes, she stood out like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The wannabes in the dance class struggled to keep up with the instructor's moves.

meanings.definition: Those who aspire to be part of a particular group or profession but are not yet accepted as such.
meanings.sent1: The wannabes eagerly awaited their chance to join the exclusive club.
meanings.sent2: He felt like one of the wannabes trying to break into the competitive industry.
meanings.sent3: The wannabes in the cooking class burned the soup, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Among the wannabes, she was the closest to achieving her dream.
meanings.sent5: The wannabes in the art studio were determined to prove their skills to the established artists.
